summary: The Kerala Service Rules amendment, effective September 1, 2014, and formalized by G.O. (P) No. 16/2019/FIN on February 20, 2019, revises rules 90 and 118 to include grandparents as eligible guardians for minor children of deceased government employees, aiming to prevent delays in payment of family pension and Death-cum-Retirement Gratuity/share.

The Kerala Service Rules amendment, as per G.O. (P) No. 18/2019/FIN dated February 20, 2019, with an effective date of July 26, 2016, modifies Rule 90(6) by omitting items (j) and (k) and Note 4, and revising Note 5 to update references and increase a figure from '15,000' to '30,000'.

The Kerala Service Rules were amended by Government Order G.O. (P) No. 18/2019/FIN dated February 20, 2019, to change the figure '15,000' to '30,000' in clause (1) of sub-rule (6A) of Rule 90, with the amendment being effective from April 1, 2015.

The Kerala Service Rules were amended by Government Order G.O. (P) No. 18/2019/FIN dated February 20, 2019, to omit the word "unmarried" in condition (i) of the proviso to sub-rule (7) of Rule 90, with an effective date of April 18, 2012.

The Kerala Service Rules were amended via G.O. (P) No. 19/2019/FIN on February 22, 2019, to add a new instruction requiring details of whether an appointment is in merit quota or reservation quota to be entered in the Service Book, effectively giving statutory validity to a previous order dated August 29, 2016.

The Kerala Service Rules amendment, as per G.O. (P) No. 20/2019/FIN dated February 22, 2019, revises pension provisions under Rule 63 to ensure that eligible employees receive at least 50% of the minimum revised scale pay if they are eligible for full pension, or a proportional amount based on qualifying service if they are not.

The Kerala Service Rules were amended by G.O. (P) No. 20/2019/FIN on February 22, 2019, to extend Note 10 benefits to employees with pre-revised pay in average emoluments due to leave without allowance up to 4 months, effective July 1, 2014, as per Rule 63.

The Kerala Service Rules were amended by Government Order G.O. (P) No. 26/2019/FIN dated March 7, 2019, to change the amount in Rule 68 from '7 lakhs' to '14 lakhs', with the amendment being effective from July 1, 2014.

The Kerala Service Rules amendment, effective July 1, 2014, and ordered on March 7, 2019, via G.O. (P) No. 26/2019/FIN, modifies Rule 90 by changing various monetary values in sub-rules 4CC and 7, specifically updating figures such as 4,500 to 8,500, 17,960 to 36,000, 59,840 to 1,20,000, and corresponding percentage-based values.

The Kerala Service Rules were amended via G.O. (P) No. 52/2019/FIN on May 3, 2019, to take effect as of August 31, 2017, revising rule 77 by adding "leave connected to inquiry into sexual harassment" after "child adoption leave" in sub-rule (ii).

The Kerala Service Rules amendment, effective August 31, 2017, adds new Rule 102 C, granting up to 90 days of leave with full pay to female employees during sexual harassment inquiries, as recommended by the Internal/Local Complaints Committee, which can be combined with other leaves except Leave Without Allowance.

The Kerala Service Rules amendment, effective immediately as of July 9, 2019, via order G.O. (P) No. 82/2019/FIN, adds a new sub-rule to Rule 59, allowing for disciplinary action to be initiated against retired employees who committed offenses while in service but received pensionary benefits without facing disciplinary action within the stipulated time limit.
The Kerala Service Rules were amended by Government Order G.O. (P) No. 123/2019/FIN dated September 6, 2019, effective July 16, 2014, to omit the words "scale of" from Note 5 to Rule 62.

The Kerala Service Rules were amended by G.O. (P) No. 123/2019/FIN, effective July 16, 2014, which omitted the words "scale of" from Note 2 to sub-rule (5) of rule 90, as per the order dated September 6, 2019.

The Kerala Service Rules were amended via order G.O. (P) No. 125/2019/FIN on September 6, 2019, effective June 29, 2015, to change "Form 2" to "Form 2B" in clause (vi) of sub-rule (13) of Rule 90, as outlined in Part III of the rules.
The Kerala Service Rules were amended via order G.O. (P) No. 125/2019/FIN dated September 6, 2019, to change 'Form 11' to 'Form 2A' in Rule 110, with the change being effective as of June 29, 2015.

The Kerala Service Rules were amended by Government Order G.O. (P) No. 125/2019/FIN dated September 6, 2019, effective June 29, 2015, to change "Form 2" to "Form 2B" in sub-clause (ii) of clause (b) of Rule 113.

The Kerala Service Rules amendment, ordered through G.O. (P) No. 125/2019/FIN on September 6, 2019, with an effective date of June 29, 2015, modifies Rule 115 by changing 'Form 2' to 'Form 2B' in clauses (b), (c)(i), and (c)(ii).

The Kerala Service Rules were amended by Government Order G.O. (P) No. 125/2019/FIN dated September 6, 2019, effective June 29, 2015, to revise Rule 117 by changing 'Form 2' to 'Form 2B' in sub-rule (1).

The Kerala Service Rules were amended effective June 29, 2015, by Government Order G.O. (P) No. 125/2019/FIN dated September 6, 2019, to add a provision in Rule 4 of Part A of Appendix X that requires applicants to submit forms 2A and 2B for commutation of pension within one year from the date of retirement.

The Kerala Service Rules amendment, as per G.O. (P) No. 125/2019/FIN dated September 6, 2019, with an effective date of June 29, 2015, modifies Form 2A to include detailed application information for pension and commutation, covering personal, retirement, and treasury details, as well as required declarations and attachments.

The Kerala Service Rules were amended through G.O. (P) No. 125/2019/FIN, effective June 29, 2015, to introduce a new Form 2B, which provides a comprehensive application for pension, gratuity, family pension, and commutation of pension, incorporating personal, service, and treasury details, among other requirements.

The Kerala Service Rules were amended effective immediately as of September 18, 2019, by G.O. (P) No. 126/2019/FIN, which modified Rule 88 in Part III, Chapter VI, by omitting the words "extraordinary pension or".

The Kerala Service Rules were amended effective immediately as of September 18, 2019, via order G.O. (P) No. 126/2019/FIN, which modified Rule 90 by omitting the words "and Extraordinary pension admissible under the rules in Appendix XIII of Part III of this rule" from sub-rule 11.

The Kerala Service Rules were amended effective immediately on September 18, 2019, by G.O. (P) No. 126/2019/FIN, which omitted specific words related to extraordinary pension sanctions from Rule 93 in Part III, Chapter VI.

The Kerala Service Rules have been amended with immediate effect as per Government Order G.O. (P) No. 126/2019/FIN dated September 18, 2019, which revises Rule 102 by adding the phrase "awarded under the Defense Service Rules" to the ruling below the rule regarding pension eligibility.

The Kerala Service Rules amendment, issued through G.O. (P) No. 126/2019/FIN on September 18, 2019, with immediate effect, omits Chapter VI and Appendix XIII entirely due to the implementation of other welfare schemes like Group Personal Accident Insurance Scheme and Ex gratia Payment, except for Defense Service Rules related extraordinary pension.

The Kerala Service Rules were amended via G.O. (P) No. 127/2019/FIN, effective September 23, 2016, to increase the duplicate Pension Payment Order fees from "rupees Two" to "rupees Two hundred and fifty" as per Rule 134, with the amendment order issued on September 19, 2019.

The Kerala Service Rules were amended via order G.O. (P) No. 127/2019/FIN dated September 19, 2019, to change the duplicate Pension Payment Order fee from "rupees Two hundred and fifty" to "rupees Two hundred and sixty five", effective March 17, 2018, as per Rule 134.

The Kerala Service Rules amendment, issued through G.O. (P) No. 165/2019/FIN on November 27, 2019, revises Rule 31 to state that interruptions in service do not count towards pension unless the interruption is condoned, with an exception for strike-related interruptions treated as 'Dies-Non', and also deletes Government Decision No.8 below Rule 14E Part III KSRs, effective December 16, 2009.
